thread.title: 'Where's my NS&I bond?'

author: Ask Jessica
title: 'Where's my NS&I bond?'
text: My partner and I both applied with £10,000 cheques for one-year and three-year 65+ Guaranteed Growth Bonds. All the cheques were cashed and my partner’s bonds were issued to him. Only my one-year bond was confirmed to me. At 82 years old, the fact that £10,000 is missing is affecting my health. RP, West Sussex Now it has been established that, instead of recording the value of each cheque against an individual purchase receipt number, which is also written on the reverse of the cheque before it goes to clearing, both your and your partner’s applications had, at the beginning, been allocated a single number. In the process of unscrambling this mistake early on NS &  I hadn’t given your three-year bond application a number. NS & I admits it took too long to acknowledge this. Greatly to your relief, after a five-month delay, the bond has now been issued. • 'NS&I can't find my £10,000' • 'NS&I put my money in the wrong savings bond' An NS & I spokesman said: “We’re sorry for the problems Miss P experienced and have offered a goodwill payment of £75 in recognition of the delay receiving the confirmation of her three-year, 65+ Bond purchase.” • If you want to contact Jessica, click here High Interest Paying Current Accounts Bank Account Name Offer More details Nationwide FlexDirect 5% on balances up to £2,500 Apply Santander 123 Account 3% on balances from £3000 Apply Clydesdale Bank Current Account Direct 2% in credit interest Apply
